decks.notes: This deck relies on using Chord of Calling and Green Sun's Zenith to tutor for specific creatures needed for its combo, while also utilizing Cauldron Familiar and Gilded Goose for resource generation. The deck also includes a toolbox of creatures that can be accessed as needed. The strategy involves setting up a strong board presence with various creatures and using them in combination with other cards to create powerful synergy and overwhelm the opponent. The deck focuses on efficiency and versatility to outmaneuver and outpace the opponent in a 1 vs 1 matchup.

The deck focuses on utilizing the synergy between Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan to quickly ramp up mana and generate explosive plays. By tutoring lands like Urza's Saga and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle, the deck can consistently assemble powerful combos and overwhelm opponents. Cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Scapeshift offer additional ways to search for key pieces, while protection and utility cards like Aftermath Analyst and Lotus Field help the deck stay resilient and adaptable. Overall, this deck aims to win through a strong land-based engine and efficient creature ramp.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to cast powerful combo pieces like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift. By utilizing lands like Urza's Saga and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle, the deck aims to assemble a lethal combination that can deal massive amounts of damage in a single turn. The deck also includes utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures to protect important spells and creatures. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board presence.

The deck focuses on using creatures with toolbox abilities to assemble a combo win condition. It utilizes cards like Chord of Calling, Green Sun's Zenith, and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician to tutor for specific creatures as needed. Cards like Delighted Halfling and Grist, the Hunger Tide provide value and synergy within the deck. The inclusion of creatures with abilities like sacrifice, counters, and life gain create a versatile and resilient strategy that can adapt to different matchups and situations. The deck aims to create a strong board presence while setting up for a game-winning combo finish.

This deck focuses on using Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast cheap artifacts from the graveyard, generating card advantage and assembling a combo win condition. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mox Opal provide additional synergy with this strategy. Urza's Saga can help find key combo pieces while also generating token creatures. This deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game in a burst of explosive plays, utilizing Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Thassa's Oracle as win conditions. It seeks to control the game early and pivot into its combo finish once the pieces are in place.

Utilizing powerful ramp spells and Eldrazi creatures, this deck aims to control the game while quickly ramping up to cast massive threats like Ulamog and Emrakul. Chalice of the Void and Palantír of Orthanc help disrupt opponents while cards like Kozilek's Return provide removal. Through the Breach allows for surprise plays, while Yggdrasil, Rebirth Engine helps maintain board presence. Devourer of Destiny and Nulldrifter provide additional threats while Ugin's Labyrinth and Eldrazi Temple help with mana acceleration. Additionally, the deck includes a small number of lands to ensure consistency in casting its powerful spells.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with a variety of cards to benefit from the graveyard interactions of the Aggro-Hollow One archetype. Cards like Mishra's Bauble, Street Wraith, and Faithless Looting help fill the graveyard while cards like Hollow One and Detective's Phoenix benefit from having cards in the graveyard. Lightning Bolt and Burning Inquiry provide additional ways to deal damage and disrupt opponents, while Orcish Bowmasters and Dragon's Rage Channeler help apply pressure on the opponent. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with early aggression and graveyard shenanigans.

The focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Splinter Twin combo by using Deceiver Exarch and Pestermite to create infinite creature tokens with haste. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Counterspell, Force of Negation, and Lightning Bolt to protect the combo and control the game. Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer provides card advantage and early pressure, while Tarmogoyf serves as a solid beatdown creature. The deck aims to win the game quickly and efficiently through the combo while disrupting opponents' game plans.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and burn spells. Key cards include Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. The deck also utilizes disruption with Thoughtseize and removal with Lightning Bolt. The mana base is optimized for consistency and allows for early aggression. The deck aims to take control of the board early and pressure the opponent to close out the game before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through hand disruption, graveyard manipulation, and counterspells while gradually building card advantage. It aims to control the game tempo by efficiently removing threats and out-valuing opponents with card draw and efficient removal spells. The inclusion of powerful threats with graveyard synergy like Murktide Regent and Graveyard Trespasser provides a win condition that can quickly close out the game once the opponent has been sufficiently disrupted. The mana base is designed to support the deck's dual-color requirements and enable consistent access to its powerful spells.

This deck aims to quickly combo off by utilizing cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Underworld Breach to generate infinite loops. It uses cards like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble to ramp up and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to dig for combo pieces. Grinding Station and Malevolent Rumble help to facilitate the combo, while Wrenn and Six provide added utility. The deck utilizes a toolbox of lands like Urza's Saga and Misty Rainforest to ensure consistency and resilience. Overall, the deck is focused on assembling the combo pieces quickly and efficiently to win the game.

This deck focuses on using Eldrazi creatures to control the game while ramping up mana quickly. The key strategy is to play powerful Eldrazi like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn as well as controlling spells like All Is Dust and Ugin's Binding to dominate the battlefield. Cards like Chromatic Orrery and Karn, the Great Creator help accelerate mana production, while Chalice of the Void disrupts opponents' plans. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big threats and disrupt their strategy with powerful control elements.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach and Grinding Station to combo off by milling through the deck and generating infinite loops with Mishra's Bauble and Moxen, fueling a powerful finish with a high storm count Grapeshot or Malevolent Rumble. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Emry, Lurker of the Loch provide card advantage and recursion, while Haywire Mite adds additional artifact synergy. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces while disrupting the opponent's game plan, ultimately overwhelming them with a lethal combo finish.
